headline: Light and Fluffy Spinach Quiche
description: This easy spinach quiche recipe is made tasty and low-fat with light mayo and reduced-fat cheese, making it the best choice for your next brunch.

video.description: See how to make a tasty, reduced-fat spinach and Cheddar quiche.
video.name: Light and Fluffy Spinach Quiche

name: Light and Fluffy Spinach Quiche
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a cookie sheet with foil.
Whisk together mayonnaise and milk in a large bowl until smooth. Whisk in eggs; set aside.
Layer spinach, cheese, and onion in the pie shell, making several layers of each. Place on the prepared cookie sheet. Slowly pour egg mixture into the pie shell, then cover quiche with foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Uncover and continue baking until the top is golden brown and filling is set, 10 to 15 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: No mayo for this recipe. So delicious and fabulous too.
I added shreaded chicken and it was delicious.
Turned out great, covering the quiche made a big difference.

I used fresh spinach, saut√©ed in spray oil, onion was also saut√©ed in spray oil, and sprinkled real bacon bits on half for me and one neighbor, his partner got it without bacon. This is a wonderful recipe! Most definitely will make this again.
Turned out great. I mixed cheddar and swiss and added some bacon crumbles.
This is my Go-To when I need to make a quiche - Easy and tasty
Loved it! It was fluffy, flavorful and easy. Followed the recipe except added a little more salt and pepper. Also I mixed all the ingredients in one bowl, mixed and poured.
BEST quiche I have ever made! The mayo was a first and so was covering it! I will ALWAYS use this amazing method no matter what optional ingredients I add. Tou will NOT be disappointed!
Very good! I added some left over chicken breast too. I will deinately be making this again!

This is my go-to quiche recipe. I tried a few to find one that gets consistently good reviews at events, and this is it! Only thing I adjust is that I steam fresh spinach and chop it. I HATE the texture and stringiness of frozen spinach. I also always make 2 at a time since the crust generally comes in a 2-pack. Just freeze one for use at another time!

This was delicious I was surprised that my husband loved it (I was hoping he wouldn't=more for me) The only thing I would do different would be to make it in a larger pie crust. Rather than that I only used 7 oz of spinach and less cheese.after making a few times I found it better to mix all ingredients instead of layering. Easier and it was great.
I used oat milk instead of whole. I saut√©ed fresh spinach and onion. Tastes greatüëçüèæ My first try I‚Äôm pretty proud Chef Teddie

Thank you for this recipe! It was deliciously simple. I was able to make it with hardly any fuss. I sauteed mushrooms , onions and 2 cloves garlic yesterday in preparation and precooked my shell. I used less spinach , still layered unto shell. Added some sauteed mushroom mix on top layer after pouring egg, heavy cream & light mayo mixture. My preference. I prefer it to be rich & creamy. (Another recipe stated I should pre-cook shell) It still was fabulous! The crust was crunchy and perfect for . Covering with foil was smart so it didn‚Äôt burn. I uncovered it after 30 mins. I placed foil around crust so center could bake thoroughly. Next time I will try without precooking, maybe. I loved the crunch ! I do recommend add some pepper to taste. The cheese I used was some imported swiss and a creamy Hoffman‚Äôs sharp cheddar. It was so delicious. Please remember to follow your instincts while cooking for yourself & family. Make life delicious, comforting & special.üåª
So fluffy! Egg texture perfect. Added ham and worked out great.
It‚Äôs now a family favorite! So easy and so good!

This made a delicious quiche and thank you for sharing ! I used fresh spinach, chopped, roasted red peppers, chopped onions, cheddar, cumin and oregano. I didn't know a quiche could turn out so fluffy! Glad I had a deep dish pie shell on hand !
Changes I made: Sautee onions, garlic, then added mushrooms and saute a little longer. Wilt fresh spinach in same pan that you sauteed onions, garlic, mushrooms. Then layer as shown in the recipe.
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??

It is long past due that I rate this terrific recipe. I have made it countless times. My preferred method and tips after multiple great results. I saute fresh spinach and onions, double the recipe using 9 eggs. Perfect amount for two quiches. If I make only one, 4 large eggs seem too few however 5 are too many. My next attempt will be one with no crust for low carb eaters.

This is so easy to make! It is moist and delicious! This has become my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù Quiche ! I have added several different ingredients to it each time I made it! Always perfect! Have fun experimenting with this! So Good!!!

It is phenomenal. Misplaced my go to quiche recipe and I tried this one. Made Quiche for my husband, my daughter's family, work associated and a senior in our neighborhood. Everyone said keep this as the #1 Quiche Recipe. Used Avocado Mayo.

Will share this recipe with my homemade Christmas gifts this year.
I didn't like the mayonaise. Didn't like the consistency and didn't have the flavor of heavy cream.

This turned out perfect. I only should have used enough salt but next time. I also made a cauliflower crust instead of flour pastry and it was divine. Everyone ate it in mere seconds. Will definitely make it again.
It was excellent. I added some ham to it.

Very easy. Very yummy. Lots of spinach but I didn‚Äôt adjust. If you don‚Äôt like spinach, I would cut back. 

Only thing I added was some chopped up turkey bacon that I saut√©ed with the onions. 

This is a keeper, go to recipe!
I made the recipe once as written; it was good as is. I read the reviews and incorporated a few ideas that work best for me. I now use the current recipe as the base for a deep dish quiche.
I added mushrooms and milk , homemade garlic butter .No pie crust. Also I used a cst iron skillet and I definitely will make it again everyone enjoyed it.
Pretty decent. I added mushrooms to mine and 2 extra eggs.
Excellent!! Followed recipe as is except for I didn‚Äôt use light. I wanted to eat seconds and more!

Love this recipe. Easy to make. Can even do without the crust for Keto options. We use an 8x8‚Äù deep glass baking dish. We play with variations too, my fav is Buffalo chicken replacing the Mayo with ranch dressing. Yum!!
really tasty and VERY easy and fast to make!
My family loves this recipe. The only change I make is using fresh spinach and saut√©ing it before adding.

It was really good. I added mushrooms, garlic clove, salt and pepper. I used some cheddar cheese but mostly mozzarella. I made my own crust and used some bacon grease in that. Lol... it was good but my heart already hurts. I also used deep dish, so I added another egg and a little milk. It was amazing!
Really fluffy! Great with the spinach. Brought this and broccoli quiche to a pot luck and they were gone first!
I added some ham and I really enjoyed this. I thought i looked nice and hope you enjoy this recipe. I would recommend it. I am gonna say this again: IT WAS AMAZING!

This turned out great! I made a few minor changes after reading some of the reviews, I cut down on the mayo by a tablespoon,sauteed the frozen spinach, let it cool then used paper towels and squeezed out the liquid.When you cover the quiche with the foil make you spray the foil really good with Pam or whatever no stick spray you use, I thought I sprayed the foil good but it stuck to the top a little bit. Will make again, maybe add some ham next time.
Love this quick and easy quiche recipe. It is always a hit!! I rarely add the onion as I am too lazy to chop it up, but it is still delicious!
Only change was using fresh spinach chopped and steamed until wilted.....Delicious!
It was really good, I added bacon to one and sausage to the other

There‚Äôs no flavor. And it‚Äôs hardly cheesy. I know it said light but I didn‚Äôt know it was going to be this light. Maybe it would be better if I took it out of the oven right after I took off the cover and eat it after cooling it down for a little bit.

I only gave this recipe 3 starts because it needed more flavouring . I tweaked it like some other reviews.....here is what I did....I kept the recipe ingredients ....I boiled the spinach with some salt and drained it. Added salt and pepper to the egg, mayo and milk mixture. I also saut√©ed some onions with red peppers . I did not layer the ingredients I mixed everything together.....the spinach, cheese , onion, red peppers all into the egg mixture added salt pepper onion powder and garlic powder. Put it all in a 9‚Äù pie crust and it came out awesome.

To die for ! I used a pillsbury ready made crust in my glass pan. I also added pieces of cooked bacon and a few sun dried tomatoes. To reheat place on a thin pan at 375 for 10 minutes. Crispy and delish !
I have made this dish a number of times and I have made modifications with it. I love it and it‚Äôs a great fish for a beginner.

This is a quick, easy and delicious recipe for quiche. It is my go-to recipe when I am in the mood for brunch. I have made it with a variety of vegetables and types of cheese and it has been delicious every time. Even my pick-eater children go back for seconds. I just plan on making two for my family of four. It also reheats well and makes a nice, wholesome meal for the kids when I‚Äôm at work.
Excellent! Everyone liked it. My husband had seconds. Thank you for sharing!

This recipe was good, but I made quite a few changes. I used fresh spinach saut√©ed in the pan with the onions. I also added another egg. I found the bake time was off, mine took an hour and I had to protect the crust to keep it from burning. With those changes it was excellent.

On the first bottom layer I added 1/4 cup of fresh basil chopped And mixed with the spinach layer. For a nice presentation at the last 15 minutes of cooking I added another light layer of cheese and then a pattern of swirls made from fresh baby spinach leaves.
Very good. I made it for my family and they like it.

I made this recipe but used sliced sweet potatoes for the crust and added 1/2 teaspoon of Siracha hot sauce to the egg mixture. 
On a subsequent occasion, I did the same thing but added 4 crumbled up Morning Star Farms Spicy sausage patties to the layers and it turned out to be an even bigger hit with my family. You could substitute regular potato slices for the crust if you like, either will absorb enough of the moisture from the cheeses that it will not be wet and runny on the bottom. I have always disliked a regular pie crust with Quiche until I figured out that the reason for its use was the absorb the moisture from the cheeses. It is much better with the potato crust and I suspect healthier as well. And since our household is vegetarian for the most part it fits our lifestyle.

I loved the mixing of oil and milk to make this fluffy. I did it in a jar to mix well. I used fresh spinach and did not saute it first. It came out great! I would suggest letting it sit for 10 minutes to set before digging in. Great recipe!
I added roasted red bell peppers and instead of the yogurt I used whipping cream. Didn‚Äôt have yogurt

It wasn't light & fluffy, but it had an excellent taste. I made it crustless & just sprayed the pie pan with Pam. I used fresh spinach (about 1/3 of a bag) & sauteed it with the onion in garlic butter (from the pizza carryout).
My favorite quiche! Switch up the veggies and cheese if you like- I tried broccoli abd swiss. Both versions are delicious!

I made this for the 1st time. I followed the recipe as is, with 1 possible difference: I used a graham cracker crust (ie, for cheesecake). It got mixed reviews from my family of 3. 
 My daughter and I (fans of spice) found it a bit bland. My wife (not big on spice) raved. A dash of Tabasco helped. 
 If I make it again, I'll try adding some peppers and maybe some extra mayo.
Simple to make and very good. Will definately make again

So easy and good! I‚Äôve thought quiche required special ingredients ; I made this from ingredients I easily had on hand. I like the fact that it only uses 4 eggs, as well! I‚Äôve now made it twice - added 1/4 c of ham and less spinach this time. This is a new ‚Äúgo to‚Äù recipe for me!
Amazing quiche
2nd time making this exactly to recipe except one thing. 1/4 c. milk and 1/4 c. sour cream to make it a bit creamier. It's my new, basic quiche recipe going forward.
I will definitely make this again. Just added a dash of salt and pepper
This recipe is easy and excellent. I actually used Miracle Whip instead of mayonnaise. It was delicious and created a perfect blend of flavors without adding any sweetness.

I cooked up some bacon, added onion, garlic, greens (mustard, claytonia, spinach), and chopped mushrooms.

Put the cooked food in the pie crust first, then layered cheese (cheddar and feta), and repeated until I used all the cooked food. Topped with the egg mixture, and I used plain greek yogurt instead of mayo.

It's super yummy!!!
Very easy to make and delicious! The only change I made was I added salt and pepper to the egg mixture.
I used fresh spinach, a little extra onion, and more cheese. Loved it! Not sure about the method of baking though.
Simple and delicious.
This was fantabulous! I made it as is with the exception of using 7 eggs due to my deep dish being super deep, lol. Definitely recommend this recipe.
This is my favorite quick! I found it years ago and make it for my family and special friends when they come to visit. It's delicious!
No changes made. It was delicious
It was pretty easy to make and tasted about a 4 out of a 5.
Added chilli and sliced potato, was very tasty and will make it again

So delicious! I used 1% milk & extra sharp cheddar. The cooking method was excellent: I baked using the exact specifications (did 15 minutes without the foil) and the quiche turned out perfectly. No matter the ingredients I use in the future, I'll use these baking specifications.
The best quiche recipe I've ever made!

I make this All the time! I prepare it exactly per receipe. Well almost. I do change up the add- ins, such as onion, mushrooms, tomatoes.
Sometimes use Swiss cheese. The base receipe is solid! If you're thinking about making this, DO IT! you will not be disappointed.

Excellent I did fresh spinach and ham
I have made this recipe several times. It‚Äôs a no fail recipe
easy and gift for R and S 12-19-2019

I really like this recipe, but it does need two more eggs if you're using a prepared pie dough you put it in a regular pie pan, like I did, instead of the frozen pie crust. I also used fresh baby spinach I had on hand, reconstituted whole milk, a pinch of nutmeg (saw this in other spinach quiche recipes), and chopped cheddar cheese slices. I love spinach so it still wasn't too much spinach but it would've been perfect with two extra eggs! Very tasty indeed! I want to add bacon and other veggies next time.
Definitely my favorite recipe!
Yes, I will make this again.

I did a couple things differently.. I mixed the mayo, milk, 5 eggs, cheddar and a little feta all together. Sauteed fresh spinach, onion, garlic, mushrooms and diced tomatoes. Mixed all together and then put into 2 pie crust. Bake as noted. Absolutely delicious! Thank you
It was delicious! Pretty easy too!
perfect! try it!

Really happy with how this came out. I used 5 eggs and added a carrot when I sauteed the onion to add color & another veggie. I thought the mayo would be weird but you don't notice it. This recipe made enough for two frozen pie crusts. One to give and one to keep. Yum!
This is so quick and easy to make especially for those late night dinners after a long day of work. Be sure to use a deep dish pie crust so the filling doesn't run over.
Sometimes I try different vegetables in this recipe if I have things that need to be used. I have grated zucchini, put frozen kale in it, broccoli, and other veggies as I have them.
It was good. I did modify the recipe though. I used almond milk, unsweetened, instead of milk. It was still great. My wife also loved it. She wants more next weekend.

This was wonderful! I did as Rockitten suggested and saute fresh spinach with onion and garlic. I used plain Greek yogurt because I did not have any mayo. Baked for about an hour. Perfection. Thank you.
Excellent! I used less spinach. Delicious
Loved it! I will add an extra egg next time and squeeze the spinach more thoroughly. But it was excellent.
The is delicious! Light and fluffy and the onion gives it great flavor. I always use fresh spinach because it‚Äôs what I have on hand.
The basic quiche recipe is fantastic! Only your imagination is limiting your combinations
easy & delicious
It wasn't quite as dense as I like my meatloaf, so it wasn't really sliceable, but the taste was stellar! Second time I've made this and I love the addition of the carrots in this!

I loved this easy receipe. Easy to make. Some slight changes:
1. Pre fry veg, baby leaf spinach, spring onions, onion, red peper, baby tomatoes, oegano seasoning , seasoned salt. let cool
2. pre make base: flour (sived), pork lard 1/4, butter 1/4, seasoned salt, praprika, rub together with 1/4 milk. make in a dough, cover with celephane.Fridge set for 20 mins. Then after roll out to shape, bake dough for 20 mins.
3. the egg mix (5 eggs serves 2 people), mix with mayo, cream cheese, whisk, then add grated cheese (add pepper to flavour).
4. add veg to base then pour over egg mix and cook for 35 mins medium oven temp.
Why do you call this quiche light and fluffy? It's not as dense as traditional quiche, but I've had awesome fluffy quiche and this recipe is no match. Tasted good though
Will definitely make again! Used 5 eggs instead of 4 as others suggested
My favorite all time quiche recipe. Have used this many times with many different ingredients. Always delicious.
This is the best quiche recipe I have ever made. So easy. I used fresh spinach though and used about half of what the recipe called for. Sauted it with the onion and 2 cloves of garlic. Delish!!!

It was sooooo yummy! The crust was slightly over cooked so maybe don‚Äôt cook it as long or cover with foil. We didn‚Äôt put mayonnaise in so we just added extra milk and one extra egg! Overall it was delicious!,

This is a keeper! 

I have been making quiche for a long time but was never happy with the denseness results. I made this with fluffiness in mind and it was amazing! 

I used olive oil mayo (that was all I had) and 2% milk and 5 eggs. 

Because I didn't have any spinach, I used green chilies, sliced olives and tomatoes. 

Best I ever made! Can't wait to invite some friends over for brunch!
Jut like everyone else I tweaked it only by adding an extra egg and extra seasonings. It was AMAZING!
